1.name: Master File Identifier
1.description: This field contains an optional code of up to 180 characters which (if applicable) uniquely identifies the application responsible for maintaining this file at a particular site. A group of intercommunicating applications may use more than a single instance of a master file of certain type (e.g., charge master or physician master). The particular instance of the file is identified by this field. Refer to User-defined table 0361 - Applications.

2.name: Master File Application Identifier
2.description: This field defines the file-level event code. Refer to HL7 table 0178 - File Level Event Code for valid values.

3.name: File-level Event Code
3.description: This field contains the date/time for the file-level event on originating system.
3.data_type: ID - Coded Value For Hl7 Defined Tables

4.name: Entered Date/Time
4.description: This field contains the date the comment becomes or became effective.

5.name: Effective Date/Time
5.description: These codes specify the application response level defined for a given Master File Message at the MFE segment level as defined in HL7 Table 0179 - Response Level. Required for MFN-Master File Notification message. Specifies additional detail (beyond MSH-15 - Accept Acknowledgment Type and MSH-16 - Application Acknowledgment Type) for application-level acknowledgment paradigms for Master Files transactions. MSH-15 - Accept Acknowledgment Type and MSH-16 - Application Acknowledgment Type operate as defined in Chapter 2.

6.name: Response Level Code
6.data_type: ID - Coded Value For Hl7 Defined Tables
